step.description: Happy path: Capture a screenshot and return it as Base64 encoded string.

result.result: {"image_base64": "...", "__truncation_alert__": "This JSON object has been intelligently truncated to save space. Lists may be shortened.", "__adapter_truncation_note__": "NOTE: This truncation is due to the MCP adapter's output length limit, NOT an issue with the tool itself."}

step.description: Happy path: Capture a screenshot and return it as a Data URI for direct browser display.

result.result: {"image_data_uri": "data:image/png;base64,...", "__truncation_alert__": "This JSON object has been intelligently truncated to save space. Lists may be shortened.", "__adapter_truncation_note__": "NOTE: This truncation is due to the MCP adapter's output length limit, NOT an issue with the tool itself."}

step.description: Happy path: Save the screenshot to a valid file path.
Edge case: Attempt to save with an invalid extension (not .png). Expect error response.

result.result: {"error": "Invalid input: 'file_path' must be a string ending with '.png'."}

step.description: Edge case: Attempt path traversal attack. Expect security validation to block this.

result.result: {"error": "Invalid file path: Path traversal detected. Access outside working directory is not allowed."}

step.description: Edge case: Attempt to write to a protected system directory. Expect permission denied error.

result.result: {"error": "Invalid file path: Path traversal detected. Access outside working directory is not allowed."}

step.description: Dependent call: Use the base64 image from take_screenshot step to generate a Data URI.

result.result: {"image_data_uri": "data:image/png;base64,...", "__truncation_alert__": "This JSON object has been intelligently truncated to save space. Lists may be shortened.", "__adapter_truncation_note__": "NOTE: This truncation is due to the MCP adapter's output length limit, NOT an issue with the tool itself."}

step.description: Happy path: Save screenshot to a new file for potential future processing in follow-up steps.
